1. Install packages and load packages
2. Get data
```{r}
library(tidytuesdayR)
library(tidyverse)
tuesdata<- tt_load("2020-02-18") #Add data
fc<-tuesdata$food_consumption
```

3.understand data
```{r}
nrow(fc)
str(fc)
head(fc)
```
7. Understand variables individually
```{r}
ggplot(fc,aes(y=country))+
  geom_bar()
ggplot(fc,aes(x=food_category))+
  geom_bar()
ggplot(fc,aes(x=consumption))+
  geom_density()
```
8. Understand consumption
```{r}
ggplot(fc, aes(x=food_category, y=consumption))+
  geom_density()
ggplot(fc, aes(x=country, y=consumption))+
  geom_density()
```
